skill.name: ensembl-database
skill.description: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant analysis, comparative genomics, orthologs, VEP predictions, for genomic research.
skill.summary: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant a...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access or environment harvesting detected. Network usage is limited to documented Ensembl REST endpoints for genomic queries.

content.value_statement: You need reliable gene, variant, and sequence data across species. This skill queries Ensembl REST endpoints with rate limiting and clear workflows.
actual_capabilities: Look up genes by symbol or Ensembl ID and expand transcript details
Retrieve genomic, cDNA, and protein sequences in JSON or FASTA
Query variants by rsID and run VEP consequences with HGVS input
Find orthologs across species and return homology details
Map coordinates between genome assemblies such as GRCh37 and GRCh38
limitations: Requires network access to Ensembl REST servers
Subject to Ensembl rate limits and occasional 429 responses
Does not provide data outside Ensembl coverage or releases

use_cases.title: Gene annotation lookup
use_cases.description: Find gene coordinates, transcripts, and cross references for a target symbol.

use_cases.title: Variant impact check
use_cases.description: Assess a variant by rsID and review predicted functional consequences.

use_cases.title: Cross species orthologs
use_cases.description: Discover orthologs for a gene and compare related species.

prompt_templates.title: Gene lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up the human gene BRCA2 and summarize its location and main transcripts.

prompt_templates.title: Sequence retrieval
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the FASTA sequence for ENSG00000139618 and note sequence length.

prompt_templates.title: Variant analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run VEP for ENST00000380152.7:c.803C>T in human and summarize key consequences.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative genomics
prompt_templates.prompt: Find mouse orthologs for ENSG00000139618 and compare gene names and IDs.

output_examples.input: Check variant rs699 in human and summarize major annotations.
output: Variant rs699 found in human variation data
Includes population frequency fields and supporting identifiers

best_practices: Use species names supported by Ensembl and verify assembly
Handle 429 responses with backoff and retry
Cache frequent queries to reduce API calls
anti_patterns: Sending large batches without rate limiting
Assuming Ensembl data covers all organisms

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides prompts and workflows that work across those platforms.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: Anonymous access is rate limited and may return 429 responses during bursts.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the provided Python script or REST examples for automation.

faq.question: Does it access my local data or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It only calls Ensembl REST endpoints for requested queries.

faq.question: What if a request fails?
faq.answer: Retry with backoff, verify species and IDs, and check Ensembl status.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual browsing?
faq.answer: It automates lookups and batch queries without using the web UI.
